title: "Monocentric City Model I"

## Overview

The monocentric city model (also known as the Alonso-Muth-Mills model) is a foundational framework in urban economics. This lecture introduces the basic structure of the model and its predictions about urban land use, housing prices, and population density.

## Key Topics

- The bid-rent function
- Land use patterns (residential vs. commercial)
- Housing prices and distance from CBD
- Population density gradients
- The trade-off between land and commuting costs
- Equilibrium conditions in the monocentric city

## Theoretical Framework

- Consumer utility maximization
- Spatial equilibrium
- Comparative statics
- Model predictions vs. empirical patterns
